intro: Leucothoe ilicifolia, commonly known as the fragrant wintergreen, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like blueberries and azaleas. The plant is characterized by its dense, sparsely foliated structure and small, elliptical leaves that turn reddish in the fall. Its flowers are white and clustered in racemes, appearing in late spring to early summer. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and shaded areas.
